p: Both Gram-positive and Gram-negative bacteria were susceptible to the T. trifidum extracts ( Table 3). However, the aqueous extract exhibited the lowest antibacterial activity on both Gram-positive and Gram-negative bacteria with MIC values greater than 5 mg/mL. The standard erythromycin exhibited the highest antibacterial activity with MIC values within the range of 0.001–0.008 mg/mL. The acetone extract was active against all the bacterial isolates except B. cereus and S. aureus. All bacteria types were affected by methanol extracts except S. aureus.
